sameAnalysis.word_list: car, bus, truck, lorry, coach, automobile, jeep, carriage, waggon
means: car ： 多指乘坐人的小汽车或轿车。
bus ： 一般指公共汽车或大型客车。
truck与lorry同义，都指卡车或货车，前者为美国用词，后者用于英国。
coach ： 原义指四轮马车，现指轿式汽车，长途公共汽车，还可指火车设有卧铺的车厢。
jeep ： 吉普车，指一种小型轻便、适合在崎岖路面或野外使用的车子。
carriage ： 指马车，两匹或两匹以上马拉的四轮马。
waggon ： 指四轮运货马车或牛车，也指铁路的无盖货车。

sentence.Network_en: I never go on the bus into the town.
sentence.Network_cn: 我从不坐公共汽车去城里。

sentence.Network_en: I saw Louise walking slowly to the bus stop.
sentence.Network_cn: 我看见路易丝慢慢地走向公共汽车站。

entry.def: A bus is a large motor vehicle which carries passengers from one place to another. Buses drive along particular routes, and you have to pay to travel in them.

example.ex: He missed his last bus home...
example.tran: 他错过了回家的末班车。

example.ex: They had to travel everywhere by bus.
example.tran: 他们只得乘公共汽车出行。

entry.tran: 用大客车运送；乘坐公共汽车
entry.def: When someone is bussed to a particular place or when they bus there, they travel there on a bus.

example.ex: On May Day hundreds of thousands used to be bussed in to parade through East Berlin...
example.tran: 过去在五一劳动节这天，数十万人常常乘坐大巴到东柏林游行。

example.ex: To get our Colombian visas we bussed back to Medellin...
example.tran: 为了拿到前往哥伦比亚的签证，我们乘大巴返回麦德林。

entry.def: In some parts of the United States, when children are bused to school, they are transported by bus to a school in a different area so that children of different races can be educated together.

example.ex: Many schools were in danger of closing because the children were bused out to other neighborhoods.
example.tran: 很多学校面临倒闭的危险，因为学生被校车送到其他社区就读了。

means.word_mean: 1. a vehicle carrying many passengers; used for public transport;

sentences.sentence: "he always rode the bus to work"

means.word_mean: 2. the topology of a network whose components are connected by a busbar
3. an electrical conductor that makes a common connection between several circuits;

sentences.sentence: "the busbar in this computer can transmit data either way between any two components of the system"

means.word_mean: 4. a car that is old and unreliable;

sentences.sentence: "the fenders had fallen off that old bus"

means.word_mean: 1. send or move around by bus;
3. remove used dishes from the table in restaurants

sentences.en: When we first lived here there were no buses.
sentences.cn: 我们最初住在这里的时候没有公共汽车。

jushi.english: I need some change to take the bus.
jushi.chinese: 我需要些零钱乘公共汽车。

jushi.english: If you have a car, you're independent of trams and buses.
jushi.chinese: 如果你有了一辆汽车,就不用依靠电车和公共汽车了。

jushi.english: Just then a bus came by so we got on and rode home.
jushi.chinese: 正好那时过来一辆公共汽车,我们就坐上车回家了。
